noun.description: A member of an American Indian people of Oaxaca in southern Mexico.
Any of a group of related languages spoken by this people, which together form the Mixean branch of the Mixe–Zoque family; this group of languages.

adjective.description: Designating, of, or relating to the Mixe or their languages.

origin: Early 17th century. From Mexican Spanish mixe, noun and adjective, perhaps from Nahuatl mīxī- (in mīxītl an intoxicating herb).
